fields.summary: Crash report #9706

fields.description:
When you right click on a commit > Tag... > the popup has the commit hash pre-entered. Pressing the Tag button at the top I assumed would do the same thing, instead it defaults the popup to "Working copy parent" with no hash entered.

I stupidly added some tags to the wrong commit because I wasn't paying close enough attention 😑
fields.summary: Pressing the Tag button in the top bar doesn't have the currently selected commit pre-entered

fields.description:
When using git locally with a remote SVN repository that has multiple branch locations defined, creating a new branch fails with the message:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false svn branch test_branch
 Multiple branch paths defined for Subversion repository.
 You must specify where you want to create the branch with the --destination argument.

It would be nice to be able to:
    # be prompted to select a destination
    # be able to select a default destination
    # be able to select a don't prompt me, always use default destination

Minimally - it would be nice if a destination was auto selected from the possible destinations and always used - possibly the user could override this.

Current workarounds are:
    # comment out other branches from the .git/config file and then remove the comment(s) after branching is complete.
   # use an svn client for branching
   # use the CLI git client and specify the --destination argument
fields.summary: Allow users to select/specify destination for svn branches

fields.description: If I press Stash files, all files being pushed to the stash, not only stagged, but all changed at the moment.
fields.summary: Stash put all files instead of staged only
HOMEWORK3
add extension to lfs result dialog has only cancel button

fields.description:
It starts from several versions before.

I checked [https://www.transifex.com/atlassian/sourcetree-for-windows/translate/#zh_CN/$/18752532?q=unstage] ,they are already translated.

But they stay in English in our application.

Screenshots are as follows.
fields.summary: "Unstage All", "Unstage Selected", "Stage All", "Stage Selected" not translated.

fields.description:
Trying to stage changes fails every time with a message that index.lock already exists. However, opening Explorer and navigating to the .git directory reveals that the lock file does NOT exist.  Trying to stage a file with all other programs closed doesn't make a difference.  I can open a terminal and use git commit without a problem.  Here's the error:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q -- platform/common/src/org/jw/service/library/LibraryManager.java
fatal: Unable to create '[my project path]/.git/index.lock': File exists.

Another git process seems to be running in this repository, e.g.
an editor opened by 'git commit'. Please make sure all processes
are terminated then try again. If it still fails, a git process
may have crashed in this repository earlier:
remove the file manually to continue.
fields.summary: Cannot stage any files

fields.description:
You right click on file(s) at Staged area and from context menu you choose "Stop tracking". Popup/Modal confirmation window appears with "Ok", "Cancel" and "Close" buttons.
1. When you click "Ok" nothing happens. Files in Staged and Unstaged areas are unchanged.
2. When you click "Cancel" file(s) moves to Unstaged area.
3. When you click "Close" file(s) moves to Unstaged area.

I consider functionality of :
"Ok" button (1.) should be to move files to Unstaged area.
"Cancel" button (2.) and "Close" button (3.) should be do nothing, cancel or close selection.

"Ok" has swapped functionality with "Cancel" and "Close".
fields.summary: "Stop tracking (files)"  action corrupted UI behaviour

fields.description: As summary says - checkboxes for files selection in Staged an Unstaged area are missing. You have to use CTRL + mouse left click to choose files which do you want to put to/from Staged/Unstuged area.
fields.summary: Missing checkboxes for selecting files in areas of Staged and Unstaged files

fields.description:
When on the File Status tab, I select one of the modified files and the diff appears on the right side of the screen. That works fine.. however, after several seconds the diff view goes away.

If I modify some files, then just bring up this view and leave everything alone it works fine. But if I have a background process running (say unit tests running), then the view refreshes and the diff disappears.

It would be nice to change this such that on-refresh the selected diff is kept up.
fields.summary: File Status diff preview disappears after several seconds

fields.description:
I'm unable to view incoming changes when using the "Pull" dialog.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Choose a repository that has incoming changes that you have not yet pulled locally.
2. Select "Pull", dialog pops up
3. Choose a specific changeset/then a specific file from within
4. The diff that should populate in the lower-right never populates
fields.summary: Cannot view revision diff in "Pull" Dialog
Authentication not working to VSO

fields.description:
It looks like the confirmation dialog doesn't have TextFormattingMode="Display" enabled on it. The font is visibly blurry (to people who notice that kind of thing, anyway). It's certainly less crisp than the rest of SourceTree.

See screenshot, which shows the same phrase in different parts of SourceTree. It's not just a matter of the font being different; the rendering style looks very much like WPF without TextFormattingMode=Display, so hopefully it's a trivial fix.

(the screenshot needs to be viewed at 100% to see what I mean, without the browser resizing it - note in particular the "i" in "files")
fields.summary: Font rendering in the confirmation dialog

fields.description:
I've disabled automatic refreshes, because too often it interferes with interactive rebases I'm performing on the command line. I would frequently get:

{code:java}
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/projects/xjtag/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
{code}

However, even with the option "Refresh automatically when files change" unchecked, I see Sourcetree refreshing while not the active window and I get failed rebases.
fields.summary: Sourcetree still refreshes when automatic refreshing disabled

fields.description: SourceTree became completely unusable for me. Used at home laptop with no issues. At work laptop SourceTree starts *multiple git processes per second* (mainly git stash list) immediately after launch effectively heating CPU to 80*C. Tried switching branches, repos... nothing helps.
fields.summary: SourceTree 100%CPU usage with multiple git stash list

fields.description:
Using two-finger scrolling on the trackpad of my laptop, the vertical scrolling is way too fast.  In the diff-view and in the list of commits, the view scrolls by more than a page by moving my fingers only a millimetre (1/16 of an inch).  Just rolling my fingertips moves the scrollbar by many pages.

When I use a mouse scrollwheel the scrolling speed is normal and even feels a little slow.
fields.summary: Trackpad Scrolling too fast on Windows HiDpi screen

fields.description: SourceTree crashes after staging, and committing new files.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after staging, and committing new files.
GUI Changes

fields.description:
Regardless of whether or not any documents are staged, clicking the 'File Status' tab shows only a blank screen.  In addition, the sidebar that shows 'File Stutus', 'Branches' and 'Tags' is empty. 

The biggist problem, however, is that clicking 'Commit' causes SourceTree to crash.

This issue has only been apparent since I updated to version 1.9.6 this morning.
fields.summary: Crashes on commit

fields.description:
Just updated to 1.9.6. Cannot stage files at all - every time I try, ST claims index.lock already exists (it doesn't).

Attached is a video of what happens. Also attached is a screenshot showing that this issue is GUI-only; command line equivalents work perfectly.

Had issue in 1.9.5 where this would _occasionally_ happen - https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5975 - but this is now literally every single time I attempt to stage.
fields.summary: Cannot stage files at all - ST claims index.lock exists

fields.description:
My favourite feature seems to have been removed from the latest version? How will we test our notifications now?

pls fix asap
fields.summary: Notifications test erroneously removed from tools?

fields.description: After merging a branch that causes a merge conflict when you switch to the File Status tab you get lots of "progress" messages saying unstaging. Several of these report errors to do with gitlock file, whilst others report success. They all overlay each other and eventually leave the branch with all the merged changes back in unstaged and no visibility of the merge conflict to attempt to resolve. Sometimes the completed "progress" messages get left on screen with no way to clear them. Opened and closed Source Tree several times with the same result each time. Version 1.9.5 does not seem to have the same problem.
fields.summary: After merge with conflict switching to the file status tab causes unstaging of all files

fields.description:
Sourcetree currently offers only global time interval for refreshing repositories. This is quite uncomfortable when you have many internal and external repositories.
For a local repositories you share with your team, you need short refresh times (1-2 minutes) to see changes. For external repositories it's quite enough to have a few hours.
Current settings with short time generates unnecessary load to external repos hosted outside your company network and makes Sourcetree slow (SCTREE barely finishes one complete refresh and goes to next one).
So it should be nice to have possibility to set interval for each repo (or folder).
fields.summary: Each repository or folder should have own refresh interval

fields.description: When I started Discard changes dialog (Shift+Ctrl+R on Windows) I must press Tab three times to make Ok button active.
fields.summary: Tab order in Discard Dialog
Sourcetree complains about index.lock and unstages added files.

fields.description:
This is a fairly new install; I'm using the most recent version of Git: 2.9.2.windows.1

Basically, after most longer operations (commit / pull / whatever ... as long as it takes a little while), SourceTree crashes.

Basically, this is so unstable that I need to get another client to continue working with Git.

As an (unrelated) side-note: The Website to report the bug also crashes almost all the time after logging in, due to a script that apparently never stops. I literally had to try 5 or 7 times, and needed to be fast enough clicking some navigation entries to cancel that script before it went crazy.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes Frequently after Operations

fields.description: When I commit code from 3rd party (Visual Studio code), in the previous version of source tree it used to show a badge about my pending push. It was helpful in notifying me that push is pending. After update it does not show that on push button on top.
fields.summary: Push button does not show badge when a commit is pending to be pushed

fields.description:
If you create and push a tag on one commit, and later create the same tag on a different commit, SourceTree will ask to move it. However, even if yes is clicked, it produces the following error:

error: failed to push some refs to '_remote repo_'
hint: Updates were rejected because the tag already exists in the remote.

So instead I have to remove the tag from the remote and push a new one. This also occurs when the move option under the advanced section is checked.
fields.summary: Moving tags feature broken

fields.description:
The commit dialog for the submodule has a very annoying bug: it can't be closed!

This seems to happen when I want to commit changes on my main project, but also have file changes on the submodule. Then ST asks me to view those changes and voila, here we are. 
Even navigating to the submodule tab itself and discarding all changes does not help.


 !image-2016-08-06-22-03-21-287.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: in-tab Commit window can't be closed for sumbodule

fields.description: when i click the StageAll or UnstageAll buttom,the files can't Staged of Unstaged (the files can't move up or down),then i select one file and click StageSelected or UnstageSelected these all files moved!
fields.summary: I must click Stage Selected ?

fields.description:
Hi,

after update i cannot Stage selected files or Stage All.
 It is immediately unstaged with this error:
{code:java}
Unable to find source-code formatter for language: txt. Available languages are: actionscript, html, java, javascript, none, sql, xhtml, xml
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q -- app/AdminModule/presenters/AdminPresenter.php
fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Users/Semik/xxxx/development/.git/index.lock': File exists.


Another git process seems to be running in this repository, e.g.
an editor opened by 'git commit'. Please make sure all processes
are terminated then try again. If it still fails, a git process
may have crashed in this repository earlier:

remove the file manually to continue.



{code}
File index.lock not exist - problem is in every Git repository.
fields.summary: Cannot stage changed files
Stage All dosnt working

fields.description:
I just updated sourcetree to version 1.9.6 and now I can't do anything with git at all in any branch or any repo. I tried updating git, using the embeded version, and checking configuration. Even when I make a git change manually via command line, opening sourctree will un-add any files I've added to ready my commit. Sourcetree is now completely non-functional for me. I always receive the following error any time I try to add a file change. 

\{\{git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false reset -q – docroot/sites/wire.ama-assn.org/themes/omega/omega/.bowerrc
 fatal: Unable to create 'C:/Users/nquam.DIGITALBRIDGE/Documents/www/ama-wire/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
 git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
 process is running and remove the file manually to continue.



Completed with errors, see above.}}
fields.summary: Cannot add any files on any repo with git - sourcetree broken

fields.description:
1. Delete some file content.
2. Open file in File status window.
3. It is possible to see, that the deleted content is removed and marked as red.
4. Select option "Discard hunk" for the modified content (deleted at 1. step)
5. SourceTree process operation and mark all the file as modified, though no additional changes has been made.
fields.summary: File marked as fully modified, when discarding changes, which involve content deletion
Aborted Compaign should not appears in Compign list page when we select "All Active Comagin"
Aborted Compaign should not appears in Compign list page when we select "All Active Comagin"

fields.description:
Sometimes the label of button is missing, only the icon appear.
 Try restarting Source Tree then it works properly.
Looks like the problem appear after I create commit and push directly to origin.
fields.summary: The button label is sometimes missing

fields.description: I'd love to be able to select non-continuous lines for staging various lines of text in source tree.
fields.summary: Stage Non-Continuous Lines
SourceTree always launches additional ssh-agent.exe when one is already running

fields.description:
Git submodules - would like a way to see the current commit hash of submodules.

Maybe in parentheses/brackets appended to the submodule name, or indented under the submodule name, or by right-clicking the submodule name... anything that makes it easy and doesn't require me to open each submodule or trace back through branch history...
fields.summary: Display submodule commit has (Git)

fields.description:
In the new UI, the tab names shown are too short.

In a large enterprise, we have hundreds of repos that use namespace naming conventions. As a result, if I have 10 repos open in different tabs, they all basically show the same name and it becomes impossible to tell which tab is which. This can be rather frustrating when dealing with a ton of repos.

Example... if I have 100 repos, all are titled such as:
 "*ABCD.MyDivision.MySector.MyComponentName*"

Then if I open 10 tabs for different repos, the tab names will all be the same:
 "*ABCD.MyDivision.MySec...*"

This might be ok when you have 2 or 3 repos... but when there are hundreds, it causes serious headaches.

There needs to be an option to allow long names in tabs, or (at the very least) allow me to hover over the tab and see a tooltip showing the full name. Preferably both of these should exist.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Cannot see full name in tabs correctly

fields.description: When creating new branch all the spaces are replaced by underscores, but when you try to rename the branch the are not and sourcetree gives an error "branch name" is not a valid branch name
fields.summary: Rename branch issue

fields.description:
Minor installation description bug, description references button choices as yes/no, while the buttons says yes/cancel.

Screenshot: http://take.ms/YZHii
fields.summary: Installation description bug

fields.description:
!image-2016-08-04-12-52-39-419.png|thumbnail! 

This UI is so much worse than what you used to have in earlier versions. There is a lot of dead space, I don't see the full filename, I can't check with checkboxes individual files. Very frustrating.
fields.summary: New UI for viewing commit content is much worse the the previous
SourceTree performing unexpected background operations

fields.description: SourceTree crashes on startup after yestday's "Windows 10 Anniversary Update". Is there a workaround to make it start?
fields.summary: Cannot start after Windows 10 Anniversary Update

fields.description:
At times the description can be quite long with all the tags associated with a commit. Wrapping this field in the the pane showing Graph, Description, Date, Commit, etc. would be quite helpful.
(Or perhaps placing the tag in separate column, so the commit description is less likely to be cut off for a given column width.)
fields.summary: Wrap Commit Descriptions

fields.description: When attempting to add an unstaged file using the keyboard shortcut "Ctrl-Shift-Plus", using the "Plus" key from the numeric keypad, the action does not execute. It only works with the "Plus" next to the "Backspace" key (standard QWERTY layout).
fields.summary: Unstaged file "Add" keyboard shortcut does not work with "+" on numeric keypad

fields.description:
SourceTree is requiring that you have an explicit username as
required for it to use the stored password when it already figures out and
enforces the username.
fields.summary: SourceTree Re-Prompts for Bitbucket Password when using GIT.

fields.description:
Hi.

If I set the spell checker to use English GB, I have to suffer significant delays when using SourceTree.

Using Taskmgr to see what the wait queues are, it seems SourceTree is waiting on RuntimeBroker.exe

Using Procmon to see what is going on there, I see MANY MANY thousands attempts to find a [random-name].dic file in my %temp% folder.

Turn off spell checking. Nice and fast again.
My temp folder is small in file count (less than 100 entries).
Happy to supply additional config if needed.
fields.summary: Using English (GB) dictionary causes runtimebroker to go slightly mad

fields.description:
Currently the diff view is cut if the diff coming from Git is to long. In one file even no diff view is shown although I get a good overview using the termin with `git diff`

Please implement to full git diff view!
fields.summary: Diff view can't handle long diff list

fields.description:
Reddit user [/u/YM_Industries|https://www.reddit.com/user/YM_Industries] reported:

> Sometimes the text for some UI buttons doesn't appear. Screenshot: 

> !http://i.imgur.com/eF3z61p.png!
fields.summary: Text sometimes missing on some UI buttons

fields.description:
Hello, i was logging with my account of Bitbucket and suddenly two dialog errors  will appears.The bitbucket say me that knows my account, for that don't need sign up previously i only log in with my atlassian count with my gmail user in the log in dialog .I'm sorry for don't give more details .I think that is only i have made.
All this happened when i was making the installation of sourcetree,completing the bitbucket account dialog and making "log in" with my data account.

I have attached the sourcetree.log

Gracias!!
fields.summary: Logging with my account of Bitbucket while was installing sourcetree

fields.description:
The problem arises EVERY time I try to change branches after a commit, a push or a pull. In order to change branches SourceTree has to be closed and reopened.

This is the dialog and error message that appears when trying to change branches.



!image-2016-08-02-10-35-46-213.png!

The error points to an index.lock file in the .git folder, but upon checking there is no index.lock file. There is the index file, of course, which makes me wonder if SourceTree is not checking the filename for the .lock extension?

This error occurs in all of my repositories. Git used outside of SourceTree does not present any issues. The error started after updating SourceTree to v1.9.5.0, so I'm convinced this is a SourceTree bug.
fields.summary: Cannot switch branches after pull, push, commit or merge

fields.description:
If you have lots of repositories then SourceTree doesn't show the full repo name in the tab.
Our repositories are namespaced, so lots start with the same text, meaning we have lots of tabs with the same text in them.

The way it stands at the moment it is impossible to use SourceTree as I cannot find the code I am looking for.

 !image-2016-08-02-14-24-29-208.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tabs do not show full repo name, making it impossible to use SourceTree

fields.description:
h2. Preamble

the issue appeared on the previous version of SourceTree (unfortunately I haven't noticed the number, I believe it was 1.8.3), and stayed after upgrade to v1.9.5; after that I have completely uninstalled SourceTree and physically removed "C:\Documents and Settings\vladimir.levchuk\AppData\Local\Atlassian" folder

h2. Steps to reproduce

1. Start source tree 

h2. Actual result
100% CPU (see screens) is used by several git.exe (when source tree started using embedded git  !2016-08-02_12h49_40.SourceTreeWin.UsingEmbeddedGit.png|thumbnail! ) or by several git-receive-pack.exe (when system git is used  !2016-08-02_12h33_04.SourceTreeWin.FirstStart.png|thumbnail! ) processes
fields.summary: 100% CPU after fresh install (1.9.5) with no repositories

fields.description: See attached image
fields.summary: Inconsistent warning message

fields.description:
I was on a particular branch and I create a new branch, but the left navigation(where all branches are shown) is not updated with the new branch. When I click on button to create new branch, it correctly shows the current checked out branch.

How to reproduce

If you have a repo opened on ST and have a branch checkout, the bookmark bar will highlight the checkout branch
Then create a new branch from the terminal
The bookmark bar won't highlight the new branch
fields.summary: SourceTree left navigation doesn't show the updated current branch which is checked out

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
- open a repository with modified files
- Go to tab 'File Status'
- Type in a commit message
- Go to Tools => Options
- Tick box 'Spell check commit message' (in my case the selected language is 'in English (GB)'

Behaviour: Application freezes; after killing the option window using the task manager the application seems to work again.
fields.summary: Frozen option window when enabling spell checker

fields.description:
When right-clicking a local branch in the sidebar, the option "Merge [branch name] into current branch" appears as per normal.

When right-clicking a remote branch (after expanding the remote node), there is no longer a "Merge [remote/branch name] into current branch".

Not a big issue, but it is annoying having to create a local branch tracking the remote just to do a merge.
fields.summary: Merge remote branch no longer an option

fields.description:
I have a remote repository on github, with ssh access through a private key. When I forget to add this key to pageant, and fetch from the remote, sourcetree will pop up a password window, asking for my github password. This authentication method fails, because I have github's two-factor authentication (2FA) enabled, which sourcetree doesn't support.
The password dialog has a cancel button that doesn't really work, the dialog keeps coming back, and cannot be closed. It cannot be closed through task manager either, so every time I make this mistake, I need to log out and back in again.
Support for github's 2FA would be great. In the absence of that, not showing the password dialog would be nice, too, and if it was possible to close it, all of this wouldn't be such a big deal.
fields.summary: Authentication window appears, never closes. github 2FA support?

fields.description: The bookmarks view now looks like a wall of black & white text. For ease of use, some kind of colored icon with user's choice of color would be better.
fields.summary: Add option to chose the color or the icon of the repo bookmark

fields.description:
In File status, in Tree View all folders containing changed files should be expanded by default.

The version 1.7.3 had it right...

Also, add option to "collapse all" and "expand all" by ctrl+click,
fields.summary: In File status, in Tree View all folders containing changed files should be expanded by default

fields.description:
From: STSP-4771

"For my HG repository, when I have uncommitted changes and try to select the topmost checkbox that will select all all files with changesets on the "File Status" tab, the box will not check and consequently the commit button will not enable.

As a workaround, I have to check individual file boxes in the "Log / History" and then return to the "File Status" tab, which will persist the files I've selected and enable the commit checkbox.

This is pretty annoying..."
fields.summary: Cannot select commit checkbox on "File Status" tab

fields.description:
I would like to be able to add notes to a branch.

I would like to be able to edit the notes later, and delete them if need be.

WHY?

I find that I frequently get interrupted and have to switch between different deliverables. I use GitFlow and so switching between feature branches is pretty easy. The problem is, sometimes I will go back to a feature branch and I don't quite remember what I had completed or where I was going with the current changes.

I do typically keep decent reminders in a notepad or text file, but I think it would be nicer/better if I could just do this on the branch in source tree. That way it is all contained together.

I am NOT saying it should be committed in the repository, or stored indefinitely. I'm thinking of this as a sort of scratch pad, to keep thoughts, ideas, progression notes for the current branch. I'm thinking of this as some sort of meta data that is associated with just source tree and the branch in question, and once the branch is deleted, so are the notes.
fields.summary: Add ability to create/store/edit/search notes on a branch

fields.description:
Expose a setting in which you'll be able to switch on/off bookmarked project name trim inside tabs.
 Currently, if you have project name which is longer than ~20 chars, application automatically trims it. This behavior makes navigation through opened projects via tabs more difficult than it should be.
fields.summary: Bookmarked project name trimmed (after 20+ chars)

fields.description:
This latest update has changed the staging system so it now takes more clicks and keyboard shortcuts to stage specific files.

There was nothing wrong with checkboxes, they've worked well for decades and are simply point and click. Having to hold control and select, then stage selected files, makes handling long lists more difficult as you also have to deal with scrolling through the list with the mouse which increase risk of losing your selection midway through
fields.summary: Add back Checkboxes when staging files

fields.description:
I have been using Sourcetree on Windows 10 for several months now, and since I started using it it was mouch slower than on Windows 7. With each new version it became more slower and slower, and in the latest version is extremely slow and totally unusable.
I have tried it on two different machines both using Windows 10, and it's extremely slow on both of them.

The machines I'm working on are powerfull enough to run very demanding applications (i7 processor, 16GB RAM, Samsung Evo SSD disk).

Here are some of the actions that are very slow:

* opening sourcetree - it takes around 2 minutes
* changing to another repo tab
* changing to another repo tab and switching back to the first one
* clicking the commit message box so that I can write a commit message
* changing branches
* pulling and pusshing
* opening a new repo tab
* closing a repo tab
* opening a repo of a submodule
* opening the "Clone/new" dialog
* sometimes it just becomes unresponsive without me taking any action
* probably some other actions that I missed to mention

Each of this actions takes a long time (1-2 min) and meanwhile Sourcetree becomes unresponsive.

From time to time (but very rare) some of this actions work without any slowness.
I have tried to uncheck this options in Tools -> Options:

* Refresh automatically when files change
* Check default remotes for updated every 10 minutes

but it didn't help, the slowness remained.

I have also done a test of this actions. During this test I have shut down all other applications and antiviruses, and resident programs and services that I could shut down. I have tried all of the actions above and all of them were slow.

During this test, I have watched the system status in task manager, and everything was normal, there was no increase in CPU and memory usage. The disk usage was most of the time on 0-1%, and it increased to 90% when I first changed a repo tab in Sourcetree. After that further changing of tabs didn't increase the disk usage, but were still very slow.
During the test the options "Refresh automatically when files change" and "Check default remotes for updated every 10 minutes" were both unchecked.

I have repeated the test with only two repos open which have a low number of commits (one has 2 commits, the other has 10) and no untracked files.
Everything was still extremely slow.

All of my repos are on git (bitbucket) and I'm using the latest version of Git:

https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases/download/v2.9.2.windows.1/Git-2.9.2-64-bit.exe

with default settings.

The repos are located on the local hard disk (SSD), and there's more than enought free disk space on it >20GB.

At the time of test I had 6 repositories opened. I have around 20 - 30 repositories bookmarked, but they were not open while I was doing this test.

None of the files in the repos were opened in an editor while I was doing the test.
"git status" works OK on all of the repos.
In the list of files, the view I'm using is "Flat list (single column)", and the filter is "Pending files, sorted by path"

I don't have a lot of untracked files. In fact, in the repos I have tested there were no untracked files.

I'm running the latest Windows 10 (64-bit) with the latest updates.

I'm attaching the sourcetree.log file.

The test was done few days ago, on 27/07/2016 with the latest version of sourcetree.

Until few months ago I have been using Sourcetree also on a Windows 7 machine and the slowness problem didn't occur there. I haven't tried the latest Sourcetree on Windows 7, but I believe this is a Windows 10 related problem. Few of my teammates have the same problem, also on Windows 10.

If you need any other info, feel free to contact me.

If you need it, I'm willing to repeat the test with a debug version of source tree that does more detailed logging. You can send me such a version and I will install it and repeat the test.
fields.summary: sourcetree extremely slow on windows 10

fields.description: When I manually add folders, subfolders and repos to the bookmarks panel these are not persisted when I restart SourceTree 1.9.5.0
fields.summary: Bookmarks not preserved

fields.description:
The "Hosted Account" functionality does not allow the use of an email style username for bitbucket accounts. Bitbucket accounts that have been migrated to atlassian accounts thus are no longer able to authenticate, as atlassian accounts are email addresses. Screenshot attached (see note below). Note that the actual authentication layer can handle it, as the username/password combination is validated successfully on the second dialog.
 * - screenshot refuses to attach, something about a missing token. uploaded here: [https://imgur.com/a/VXiKB]
fields.summary: bitbucket users cannot use their atlassian ID

fields.description: Please add an option to lock the default to File Status instead of Log/History when viewing Git repositories.  Some of our developers prefer to immediately see pending file changes first without the visual clutter of the log/history display.
fields.summary: Add option to default to File Status instead of Log/History

fields.description:
It seems to be random, but on occasion a repo I am working in will have an error where it states the lock file could not be created due to it already existing, and prevent git actions to that specific repo. Restarting source tree seems to fix the error (at least source tree works again and no longer shows the error). No other clients are running, and while I do have git integration on visual studio this has happened to repos that do not have content involved in visual studio solutions/projects.
I am unable to replicate the issue reliably, it seems to happen at random.
The message appears similar to the error referenced in SRCTREEWIN-5010, however I do not rebase these repos.
-If the error occurs appears again I will append a copy of the error and state if the lock file does actually exist, for now it is a waiting game until it happens again. Normally this issue arises about twice a day, so it should not be too long.-

{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout ~~~~~~~~
fatal: Unable to create '~~~~~~~~~/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git

process is running and remove the file manually to continue.
{code}
The lock file does not actually exist.

I can not find a reliable way to recreate the failure, I found a repo that seems to fail somewhat frequently, however it is still intermittent.
fields.summary: Lock file gets stuck, restarting source tree fixes it.

fields.description: I noticed this problem first in the beta release, but it has persisted with the official 1.9.5.0 release.  Some of the buttons in the command bar are missing text labels.  They are not always this way, but I would estimate > 50% of the time when I start SourceTree, the icons appear shifted down slightly, which is probably hiding the text beneath a different part of the UI.  This happens on multiple PCs, so it is not a single PC issue.  It is also always the same 6 icons that have this problem.
fields.summary: Icon Labels Are Sometimes Missing

fields.description:
Ideally, you'd commit your changes as soon as you're done with the "unit of work" (feature/bug fix) you're working on. But for me, in practice often you'll find yourself working for a few hours and end up with a big pile of changes. While you were working on feature X, you ended up improving a part of your code base to help support feature X and in doing so you discovered a bug that you also fixed, but those changes don't really belong to feature X and you want to create a separate commit for them. And in general, I want to create my commits as small as possible with helpful messages for each commit. So if I have 30 changed files in my unstaged files list what happens is that I'll walk through them gathering the changes that belong to feature X and commit them, and then walk through the remaining files again to gather the files that belong to the general code base improvement and commit that, and so on until I've made all my commits. The time complexity of this is approximately N * M where N is the number of commits I'd like to make and M the number of changed files :P And usually after creating a commit I'll run into a file that actually belonged to a logical commit but I forgot to include it and I'll now have to make a second commit. 

What I would really like in SourceTree is a way to create multiple staging "areas". I'd create a staging area for every logical commit I want to make and walk through all my changes only once and add each change to the would-be commit it belongs to. So instead of one "staged files" you have multiple. This would make my commit process much more enjoyable. 

Of course, one problem I see with this feature request is that I don't think there's an underlying git/mercurial construct to back this feature. As far as I know, there's no way to stage a file in a different staging area than other files. But I'd like your opinion on this.
fields.summary: Multiple "staging areas"

fields.description: When I click the buttons nothing happens, files are staged only when I select all files and click "Stage Selected"
fields.summary: "Stage All" and "Unstage All" are not working.

fields.description: After updating to version 1.9.5.0 the performance, switching between repos, click Commit takes ages to perform action.
fields.summary: 1.9.5.0 very slow, freeze when switching between tabs/repos

fields.description:
After the fresh installation, I came to the "Load SSH Key" windows says 'click' No, but No button is missing on screen. But 'Yes' and 'Cancel' was presented.

Should be a text update
fields.summary: "Load SSH Key" windows says 'click' No, but No button is missing on screen

fields.description:
From support ticket (STSP-4755):

"So I've been meaning to report this for sometime, but for a while I thought it was my fault. But taking some time today I was able to replicate the issue several times.

If you create a folder and add bookmarks into it, then try to drag that folder to a position lower in the tree, any existing folders will expand and prevent you from dragging past. But I'm sure you've been aware of this for a long time.

If that wasn't infuriating enough - and this is the big on - if you accidentally drag to the right outside of the tree area and let go of the mouse button (because you just remembered that this isn't going to work anyway), the folder completely vanishes. Yes, it's gone. I doesn't end up in another folder or anywhere else. I have to create all those bookmarks again. Sometimes you can even do it by dragging an existing folder of bookmarks upwards and letting go of the mouse button.

So no I have to go and add all those working copies again.

It's 2016. Surely file tree management should be the least of anyone's problems."
fields.summary: Managing bookmarks in the file tree is buggy

fields.description:
I have a Bitbucket account as heather_gates and an Atlassian account heather.gates. My Atlassian account had problems after our company merged Confluence & JIRA see other support tickets and my heather.gates login would not work when setting up SourceTree. I was being stopped at the "Use existing Atlassian account" section since it would not take my legit Atlassian account. 

I created a temporary Atlassian account with email heado.gates@gmail.com, and was successfully able to use that during SourceTree setup. We followed the steps to Clone and connect to Bitbucket, and it takes my heather_gates login info. However, it does not load the repository, it just cycles indefinitely.
 Since the heather.gates Atlassian account appears to have been fixed in a prior ticket, I have been searching for some way to change from my "temporary" heado.gates@gmail.com account to my legit account within SourceTree to see if that fixes the Bitbucket misalignment, but have found no solution.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled SourceTree multiple times but am never presented with the initial setup wizard. It remembers all of my info. I have been searching help documents but everything points me to the location to update my Bitbucket login info, which is already correct.

Where do I go to manually update the originally entered Atlassian account information in SourceTree so the Bitbucket files show up?
_
fields.summary: Bitbucket repository not cloning in SourceTree

fields.description:
When checking for updates on one of my machines, it fails with the error "Checking for Updates - It was not possible to connect to the revocation server or a definitive response could not be obtained."
 This occurs whether or not Windows Firewall is on. Looking at the SourceTreeUpdate.ini it looks like the actual update mechanism just checks an HTTPS page, which the machine definitely has access to.
 Is there some other mechanism, such as a different port / protocol, that this "revocation server" connection is trying to do, which I need to add in my firewall?

fields.summary: Sourcetree checking for updates fails -- cannot connect to "revocation server"

fields.description:
I updated SourceTree on Windows to the latest version yesterday and had two crashes while committing with the "Push changes immediately to origin..." check box on.
 I choose to debug with VisualStudio and the problem is a stack overflow with the following stack trace (excerpt):

fields.summary: SourceTree Windows 1.9.5.0 crashes when committing

fields.description:
On previous versions the source tree app did have this two important options for workflow

* been able to click on a check box do move up or down on the stash on git
* been able to drag and drop


Now with the buttons, I need to switch back and for when doing single file or cherry picking files.
fields.summary: You deleted the check box and drag and drop

fields.description:
Since upgrading to version 1.9.5.0 (Windows 7 x64 SP1 fully patched), I notice that sometimes (not always), the icons to the right of pull on the main top toolbar (e.g. fetch gitflow etc.), show the graphic symbol for the icon but not the text below it. This occurs at random, but doesn't ever seem to be noticeable at application startup. I am wondering therefore if it's a GDI resource leak issue (or similar).

For some reason I cannot attached the screenshot - as I get a message: "Jira could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again". If you contact me by email, I can send it.
fields.summary: Minor issue: Toolbar icons are sometimes incomplete (no text etc)
During install, on the "Load SSH Key?", It says that you can click 'No' but the only options are 'Yes' and 'Cancel'
Tree File Listing "Expand All", "Collapse" buttons

fields.description: I don't know what happens, but after a few hours of using, SourchTree adds a reset action after each action it does. I can't work anymore. I can't stage files, nor do other actions. I reinstalled the beta version this morning, now this problem re-occured. Please tell me, which information you need to process this really strange problem.
fields.summary: SourceTree resets all actions

fields.description: Screenshots hope will help.
fields.summary: ruined toolbar icons & unstaged changes list lost checkboxes

fields.summary: Crashed while typing a commit message, updates were available after re-opening the app

fields.description:
I got the following Error while trying to connect Sourcetree with Bitbucket Server. (See Attachment Error_Source_Tree.png)

I try it on Mac OSX 10.10 with the same configs, there it works.

Maybe some configuration of windows is blocking the connection? I can connect with the repos on bitbucket without any problems.

Firewall from bitdefender was disabled for testcases.
fields.summary: Login failed for your Bitbucket Server account on Windows 10

fields.description:
SourceTree 1.9.5 is constantly asking for Authentication for the remote server. This happens almost every 15 minutes.

When I work with my repos, everything works fine, and I am not asked for the authentication.

There is no indication why SourceTree need the authentication credentials.

The Authenticate dialog also takes focus from other windows which is very annoying when typing something and the SourceTree will display the dialog.

Expected behavior: SourceTree should not periodically display the Authentication dialog.
fields.summary: SourceTree is constantly prompting for authentication

fields.description: I moved a file using TortoiseHG. SourceTree showed the file with the R icon (not a separate remove and add), so it appeared to recognise the file move. When I committed the file, then it showed the removal of the file at the old location as uncommitted and the history shows the addition of the file at the new location committed. I then had to separately commit the removal.
fields.summary: Moving files is recognised, but add and remove is committed separately
UI doesn't refresh when errors occur after branch creation
Add keyboard shortcut to switch between current branch and all branch display

fields.description:
When pushing all branches, ahead-of-remote branches succeed and behind-remote branches fail as normal. 

However, the GUI no longer refreshes to reflect this - the GUI thinks _all_ branches failed to push. Restarting ST fixes this on the branch view, but the push button still shows a number.

Two image files attached to show this - one immediately after the 'failed' push, the other after subsequently restarting ST.
fields.summary: 'Ahead' status not refreshed when some pushes fail

fields.description:
After upgrading to version 1.9.5 through the built in automatic upgrader the program no longer runs. When trying to run it there is a pause fora  few seconds and then the crash logger pops up telling me there has been an error and offers to send off the error details.

The sourcetree window doesn't appear at all in this process.

After downgrading to version 1.6.23 (whose installer I had around) sourcetree works once again and I can view my repositories and do things with them.

In case its relevant the repositories that I use are mercurial repositories.

I can try to provide more information if you can tell me where to find it (ie any logs created that haven't already been autosubmitted to your crash manager/data collection thing.
fields.summary: Application crashes on startup

fields.description: Testa
fields.summary: Testio

fields.description:
Since the latest version I'm not able to use the keyboard to delete or discard files. If I use the corresponding shortcut, the confirm dialog pops up. But now I can't press enter to confirm, by pressing enter it cancels the action. If I press left, nothing happens, if I press tab I have to do like 5 times to get the right button focused.
I'd like the old behaviour back where the ok button automatically has the focus again
fields.summary: Default focused button on confirm dialogs

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Change a file, click _Stash_ and name it 'a'
# Change another file, click _Stash_ and name it 'a'

Result
* Two stashes with the same name.
* If you click on one of them both are selected (see attached screenshot)

I would expect that you cannot create two stashes with the same name (and avoid the UI issue).
fields.summary: Two stashes with the same name confuse UI
